intro: Ouratea surinamensis, commonly known as the Surinam ouratea, is a flowering plant native to the rainforests of South America. It belongs to the family Ochnaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, white or pink flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
